Abstract: Flamma Mvunelwa, 77-year-old retired teacher in Mlungisi, South Africa, considers widespread protests and disruptions that swept up nation's young people in 1980's to be the most profound experience of her life; Mvuselemo Jompolo, 13, hopes to make life better in Mlungisi by building houses; photos; chronology of South African history since 1910 (M)
Snippet: Flamma Mvunelwa, 77-year-old retired teacher in Mlungisi, South Africa, considers widespread protests and disruptions that swept up nation's young people in 1980's to be the most profound experience of her life; Mvuselemo Jompolo, 13, hopes to mak...
LeadParagraph: Flamma Mvunelwa, 77, and Mvuselelo Jompolo, 13, both live in Mlungisi, a township in the eastern Cape province of South Africa.

Headline.Main: 'Children Saw What We Had Not Seen, That We Must Fight.'
Headline.PrintHeadline: REFLECTIONS: SOUTH AFRICA; 'Children Saw What We Had Not Seen, That We Must Fight.'
